MethParquet 0.1.0

    • Methylation Association Analysis using MethParquet
    • Using MethParquet for Methylation Risk Score and Differentially Methylated Regions

    Test Methylation Risk Score against a phenotype chosen

    test_mrs.Rd

    Test Methylation Risk Score against a phenotype chosen

    test_mrs(db_obj, phe_data = FALSE, mrs, outcome, covariates = FALSE)

    Arguments

    db_obj

    Methlist containing the phenotype data (subject annotation) created using create_methlist Sample names in phenotype data should be matching sample names in `mrs`. Set `db_obj` to `FALSE` if `phe_data` is specified.

    phe_data

    Phenotype data in data frame format. Default: `FALSE` Sample names in `phe_data` should match sample names in `mrs`

    mrs

    Methylation risk score, like the matrix obtained from function dev_meth_score

    outcome

    Column for outcome inside phenotype data.

    covariates

    covariates to be included in the model. Default: `FALSE`

    Value

    A list containing fitted model and coefficients estimates of methylation risk score (MRS). For multinomial logistic regression, the list will also contain likelihood ratio test for MRS.

    Examples

    library(tidyverse)
library(arrow)
library(nnet)
library(car)
#> Loading required package: carData
#> 
#> Attaching package: ‘car’
#> The following object is masked from ‘package:dplyr’:
#> 
#>     recode
#> The following object is masked from ‘package:purrr’:
#> 
#>     some
data(phenoData)
data(chrAnnotation)
data(ewas_bmi)
wdir <- getwd()
methpath <- system.file('extdata','MethData.csv',package='MethParquet')

# Create Parquet data and MethList
path <- paste0(wdir,'/Parquet_Directory')
write_parquet_meth(data_path=methpath,format='csv',group_by='CHR',parquet_path = path)

mlist <- create_methlist(db_path = path,cpg_col_db='CpG',subject_annot = phenoData,
subject_col_keep='all',cpgAnnot_col_keep=c(1:2,12:13,16),cpg_annot = chrAnnotation,
subject_id='sample_id',cpg_col_annot='Name', gene_col_name = 'UCSC_RefGene_Name')

# Calculation of MRS associated with BMI
mrs_bmi <- dev_meth_score(db_obj=mlist,cpg_col='CpG',meth_effect_data = ewas_bmi,effect_col='Effect',
NAs_to_zero=TRUE)

age <- test_mrs(db_obj = mlist, outcome = 'age', covariates = c('sex'), mrs = mrs_bmi)
age[[2]]
#>                   mrs
#> Estimate   6.22372215
#> Std. Error 2.82011604
#> t value    2.20690286
#> Pr(>|t|)   0.02967952
unlink(path,recursive=TRUE)
